titlestmt.titleproper: RG 079:016, Department of Environmental Protection: Natural Resources and Outdoor Recreation
titlestmt.subtitle: Inventory of Records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Connecticut State Library staff.

publicationstmt.p: Copyright © 2008 by the Connecticut State Library

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Paul E. Baran on February 11, 2008

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.unittitle: Department of Environmental Protection natural resources and outdoor recreation records
did.abstract: Natural Resources and Outdoor Recreation records include: Law Enforcement; Deputy Commissioner; Parks and Recreation; Water and Related Resources.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: With the creation of the Department of Environmental Protection in 1971, the Preservation & Conservation Division was given the mission to protect, conserve and mangage the land, water and wildlife resources of the state.1 Now known as the Bureau of Natural Resources and Outdoor Recreation, this part of the Dept. of Environmental Protection has always been based on species management (fisheries, wildlife, forestry) and land use (recreation, open space, natural areas, etc.)2

list.head: Endnotes
list.item: 1Press release, November 22, 1971, RG 079:001, Department of Ennvironmental Protection, Commissioner Arthur J. Rocque, Jr., Accession 2005-009, Organizational Evaluation, Box 6, Folder "First DEP Org Dan Lufkin Documents".
2Untitled and undated document, RG 079:001, Ennvironmental Protection, Commissioner Arthur J. Rocque, Jr., Accession 2005-009, Organizational Evaluation, Box 6, Folder "Historic Org Charts".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series numbers have been assigned within RG 079 in its entirety and therefore the series described here are not numbered consecutively.

Series 2. Law Enforcement, 1940-1987
Accession: 1993-134, Arrest Cards, 1940-1978, 4 cubic feet
Accession: 1993-136 (part), Correspondence, 1973-1987, 0.75 cubic feet

Series 16. Deputy Commissioner, 1975-2006
Accession: 1995-062, Theodore Brampton (? - 1979), Dennis DeCarli (1979-1991), Thomas Dudchik (1991-1993), George Avitable (1993-1995), 1979-1995, 10 cubic feet
Accession: 2006-007, Susan C. Lavoie, 1995-1998, 8 cubic feet
Accesion: 2007-010, David K. Leff, 2000-2006, 1 cubic foot

p.emph: Series 24. Parks and Recreation, 1975, Accession: 2003-017, 0.5 cubic feet

arrangement.p:
Series 27. Water and Related Resources, 1966-1975
Accession 1988-027 (part), Joseph O. Elmer, Senior Civil Engineer, 1966-1975, 1 cubic foot

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p:
Additional Department of Environmental Protection records can be found in:
RG 079:001, Central Office
RG 079:004, Aerial photographs, see the .
RG 079:006, Air, Waste and Water
RG 079:018, Office of Indian Affairs

As well in these predecessor departments, boards, and commissions:
RG 079:003, Board of Fisheries and Game
RG 079:017, State Park and Forest Commission
RG 079:022, Forestry Department
RG 079:023, Water Resources Commission
RG 079:026, State Harbor Commissioners for New Haven Harbor

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: These records are stored at an off-site facility and therefore may not be available on a same-day basis.

scopecontent.p: Information cards documenting arrests for violations of hunting and fishing laws and regulations. Includes materials from the predecessor Board of Fisheries and Game.
Part of this accession is correspondence from the Board of Fisheries and Game, the predecessor to the Law Enforcement Division, and is described in the finding aid for that Board.

physdesc.extent: 18 photographs mounted on board and 13 loose photographs in unnumbered box

note.p: Some are postcards. Some of the loose items had once been mounted on the board but came off.

scopecontent.p: Includes a photograph of Deacon Phineas Meigs' Farm Island House.
